results.title: Babies Are People Too (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An anti-child abuse film for young mothers to give them a better understanding of how their infants develop during the first two years and how behaviour is an expression of their infant’s needs. The objective is to make better mothers, and hence, better adjusted babies.

results.title: Backs to the blast: an Australian nuclear story
results.brief_description: A history of the Uranium and nuclear industry in South Australia from 1910 to 1980, including archival footage and contemporary interviews with workers, scientists and politicians. Presents an analysis of the effects of uranium and its products and gives a detailed examination of Radium Hill, Port Pirie and Maralinga. Suitable for lower-mid Secondary students.

results.title: Babes in toyland
results.brief_description: Santa Claus’s incompetent assistants accidentally make some giant wooden soldiers, which come in useful when a villian tries to take over Toyland. A musical fantasy based on the Operetta by Victor Herbert and Glen McDonough with music adapted and conducted by George Bruns and choreography by Tom Mahoney. Stars Ray Bolger, Tommy Sands, Annette Funicello, Ed Wynn.

results.title: Babe: pig in the city
results.brief_description: The sequel to the 1995 surprise hit ‘Babe’ moves the action of the first film into the vast unknown of a sprawling metropolis. Along with the radical change comes a surprisingly dark undertone. What launches Babe’s adventure is an unfortunate well accident involving farmer Hoggett. Babe, along with Mrs Hoggett, must then head into the big city to drum up money and save the farm from bankruptcy. Once there the native duo are separated and Babe finds himself in a strange boarding house for animals. Although critics feared the film might have been too intense for kids, Miller’s film is full of compassion, pathos and unexpected poignanacy.

results.title: Babar: The City of Elephants
results.creator_credit: Raymond Jafelice, Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh and Patricia Loubert
results.brief_description: Babar Returns - Babar leaves the old lady and the city to return to the jungle so that he can bring the other elephants his newfound knowledge. But he finds that they resist trying any of his new ideas. “City of the Elephants” - As the elephants new king, Babar’s first decree is to build a city. However, he must contend with Lord Rataxes, who is also trying to build a city, as well as his own obsession to see his city completed on time. Rated: G

results.title: Babar. to Duet or Not to Duet; the Missing Crown Affair.
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Laura Shepherd, Belvama-Ellipse, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Clifford Ross Co
results.brief_description: Two more animated versions of the Babar picture books. “To duet or not to duet”. The young Babar is scheduled to perform a duet with a great pianist at a concert, but he refuses to admit that the piece is too hard for him. “The missing crown affair” When Babar’s crown goes missing, Zephir decides to help solve the mystery. Could the stolen crown be the first step towards taking over Babar’s kingdom? Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.
results.title_for_label: Babar. to Duet or Not to Duet; the Missing Crown Affair.

results.title: Back against the wall [DVD]
results.brief_description: Midwest experimental filmmaker James Fotopoulos embraces his trademark grim cinematic style for his third feature, a film that explores the themes of loneliness, isolation, relationship dysfunction and personal alienation. Levey is a depressed and physically ill man, living in a stark apartment with few furnishings and little to occupy his time other than stew over the comings and goings of his attractive girlfriend, June who works in a strip club. Levey also plays chess and ping-pong with his disfigured friend Ed, who lusts after June. In the second chapter June leaves Levey for the more dynamic Vince, and to her dismay, is soon performing in pornography. In the final section Ed is witnessed in his flat where he is visited by an array of prostitutes. This film is all about the possibilities of aggression, violence, repressed angers and despondency. There is a seething despair that permeates the mise-en-scene, rendering the viewer poised for interactions, for revelations, for insights (verbal and symbolic) into these protagonists’ plights. Haunting score by Tom Nicholl, Bob Davies and Alex Horm, presents a warped industrial sound-scape utterly joyless in its evocation of the limited opportunities and futureless possibilities where these characters dwell. Cast includes Martin Shannon, Michael Wexler, Debbie Mulcahy and Ernie E. Franz.

results.title: Babar. Story of Babar the little elephant. Babar comes to America.
results.creator_credit: Bill Melendez, Ed Levitt, Lee Mendelson and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Narrated by Peter Ustinov and based on the Brunhoff books about Babar the King of the Elephants. “Story of Babar the little elephant” introduces us to Babar. After his mother is shot by hunters he runs away to Paris where he is adopted by a kind little old lady. Although he loves her he misses the jungle and returns home where he is crowned King of the Elephants and marries his true love, Celeste. Based on “The Travels of Babar” and “Babar comes to America” episode two follows Babar and Celeste as they travel first by balloon, then whale and ship to America where they become movie stars.

results.title: Babar. Elephant's best friend; The Show must go on
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Laura Shepherd, Ellipse and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Join Babar in two more delightful episodes: 1. “An Elephant’s Best Friend” - Lord Rataxes stops all pomegranate shipments from reaching Celesteville, but when Babar calls on the help of a warthog, Rataxes is suddenly willing to talk. 2. “The Show Must Go On” - Babar organises a world-class ballet to be performed in Celesteville, but the star of the show, a temperamental prima ballerina, causes problems for cast and crew. Based on the books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.

results.title: Babar. Babar's Triumph
results.creator_credit: Laura Shepherd, Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clifford Ross Co and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Two stories: “Babar’s triumph” and “Babar’s choice”. “Babar’s triumph”: Babar faces his greatest challenge when the Hunter returns to threaten his kingdom. He must unite Lord Rataxes and everyone in the jungle to fight the Hunter and repel him once and for all. “Babar’s choice”: Babar’s advisers, Cornelius and Pompadour, jeopardise his relationship with Celeste by insisting that he take the Gorilla King’s daughter to an important palace ball instead of Celeste. Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.
